questions.question: You live at 12km from Ali's house. You start jogging at 6km/h towards Ali's house. Ali starts jogging at 5km/h towards your house, but starts 10 minutes later. What distance would you have run when you meet him?
tips: Step 2: Calculate Distance You Travel in 10 Minutes
Remaining distance when Ali starts: 12 − 1 = 11 km
When both of you are jogging towards each other, the relative speed is the sum of both your speeds
Time to meet: 11 km / 11 km/h = 1 hour
Step 6: Calculate Distance You Have Run
Total distance you run: 1 km (initial) + 6 km (in 1 hour) = 7 km
You will have run 7 km when you meet Ali.

questions.question: You have 900 liters of water in a vessel. You received an order to transfer the water into containers of 60 liters. How many containers will you need?

Now the same container with 900L of water starts leaking as soon as you start the transfer at the rate of 2L per minute at the valve over the total transfer. How much water will you be wasting knowing that it takes 15 minutes to transfer to each container?
tips: Number of containers = 900 liters / 60 liters/container = 15 containers
Total transfer time = 15 minutes/container * 15 containers = 225 minutes
